102
Observing careful habits to prevent burns is most important (see chapter 3 for 
details).
Injuries
CutsThe important point in dealing with cuts is to try and stop the bleeding or get 
medical help as soon as possible if the bleeding is excessive.  The cloth used as 
bandage for the cut has to be clean.  A dirty cloth should not be used under any circumstances.  
What to do in case of cuts:
✱  The affected part must be washed with soap and water and pressed to stop bleeding.
✱  Ice, if available can be used to stop bleeding.
✱  An antibiotic ointment (available with the health worker) should be applied and a bandage tied using a clean cloth.     
    
A cut with a lot of bleeding:
✱  Should be washed with soap and water.
